page.title: 01Kirroughtree Forest
page.content: A forest area at the foot of Cairnsmore of Fleet, planted mainly in 1953 to mark the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. Now being extensively felled for timber and replanted with seedling conifers. A tree nursery is maintained by the Forestry Commission to provide seedlings for all forests in South West. Natural Lochs in the forest are stocked with Trout as a sporting amenity. Nature trails are also maintained as a further public amenity and unrestricted pedestrian access is allowed throughout the forest.
